metadata.title: CVE-2020-11884 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel 4.19 through 5.6.7 on the s390 platform, code executionmay occur because of a race condition, as demonstrated by code inenable_sacf_uaccess in arch/s390/lib/uaccess.c that fails to protectagainst a concurrent page table upgrade, aka CID-3f777e19d171. A crashcould also occur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-99-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-generic - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-99-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
